content: in this legal case mr co fa brought a claim to court regarding a property the court found that his main claims were not valid due to an urban planning issue with the property the court also dismissed his request for reimbursement of payments made for the property the case began in december 2020 with a formal summons and both parties appeared in court in march 2021 the case proceeded with written proceedings and a hearing was scheduled for february 2022 the plaintiff requested documentation and the defendant contested the claims the plaintiff requested the division of the inheritance and the dissolution of coownership of the property the court determined the value of the property and allocated shares among the coowners if the property cannot be divided it may be sold and the proceeds distributed the court also addressed the division of a postal account and rejected additional claims made by mrs ca the court denied a counterclaim made by mr se and determined the amount of compensation to be paid the court also addressed improvements made to the property and the reimbursement of expenses the court concluded that the reduction claim made by the plaintiff was not valid and that gifts received by the deceased should not be considered in the division of the estate the court analyzed the assets of the estate and made determinations regarding their distribution the court also addressed the rights of mrs ro to the property and the reimbursement of her expenses the court concluded that each party should bear their own costs and that the coownership of the property should be divided the court ruling was made on december 20 2022
